subtasks: Approach and identify goats one by one.
Check for proper vaccinations and administer if needed.
Sort nannies from kids for proper banding.
Conduct ear tagging or ear notching for gender identification.
Examine goats' feet for any issues and tend to as necessary.

tasks.task: Vary different tasks as per need, like ear tagging, banding, etc.
subtasks: Identify multiple goats at once for quicker processing.
Use appropriate equipment for banding and vaccines.

tasks.task: Handle goats while moving them to different pens.
subtasks: Use pens to sort animals into smaller groups.
Ensure efficient movement of goats through pens to minimize stress.
Show goats grazing on browse and forbs.
Discuss impact of goats on controlled areas versus unmanaged brush.
Introduce goats into a previously grazed area.
Observe the effect of goats on browse lines and residual vegetation.
Inspect goat fence for durability and effectiveness.
Note necessary repair or improvement of fence.
Administer vaccinations to protect against clostridial diseases.
Apply preventative measures like ear notching for male identification.
Properly restrain goats for examination and treatment.
Communicate safely with team members during handling.
